website_summaries.verdict: Lasts a long time and adapts to  temperatures between 6°F and 52°F.
pros: A wax that gets even better as time goes on
One of the few options that can be rubbed in or ironed on to equipment
Preserves skis and snowboards for multiple seasons
cons: Not designed to fill large gaps or gouges in equipment

customer_reviews.title: Southern california boarding wax use
customer_reviews.text: I use this wax and I board at my local mountains the most like Mt High or Big Bear and sometimes Tahoe and Mammoth and works great all season never have a problem with it but if you hit low temps like 20F below you should get a colder wax but this stuff still works great last a few times but I wax more often then I should, so could last you the whole season if your a light ski/boarder. When I use it mostly in 28F-36F it works better then more expensive waxes and here in Cali that's a normal day time temp on all the mountains here.
customer_reviews.author: Roor

customer_reviews.title: Super Hot Sauce is the clear winner
customer_reviews.text: I'm admittedly pedantic about wax/tune. Here in OR we get a large variety of snow-types. My local has many runs with loooooonnnnnggg traverses back to the lift. For all these reasons, I have tested the hell out of every (semi-affordable) wax out there, trying to find the fastest and longest lasting. Super Hot Sauce is the clear winner, being the fastest across the largest temperature range (incl spring slush), and lasting the longest. My long search is over!
customer_reviews.author: Quint T. Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Just ok...
customer_reviews.text: Have used this wax on one board and a competitors wax on another. Both boards same base material. Board with this wax was NOT even close to as fast as the board with competitors. During waxing process it goes on clean and spreads evenly bUT while scraping it flakes quite a bit more than the other wax. (Where as the other wax stays in big long scrapings) It will work in a pinch but is def. Not my 'go too' wax. 3 stars is for price but Im willing to pay more for performance.
customer_reviews.author: Brush WolfTop Contributor: Snowboarding

customer_reviews.title: Works in crapy East Coast 40 degree slush and Ice
customer_reviews.text: I hardly think "works 40 degree crappy East Coast slush and ice" is the kind of feedback Hot Sauce wants to hear but it actually worked pretty good. Wax went on board easily and really did work well. Actually was my son who waxed and rode with it but was with him and that was his feed back. He just waxed my board with it and I'll date it when we score some epic 20 degree sheet ice moguls and chunder!
customer_reviews.author: waterdog

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Darn Good Wax
customer_reviews.text: Like all temp waxes, this is not a perfect wax in every condition. If your only concern is going faster than the next guy, this might not be for you (a temp specific race wax would probably serve you better). As a avid recreational skier (30-40 days a season) this stuff works great for me. I wax my skis every 3-5 days depending on snow conditions, and seems to do the trick. Its also a great big brick that lets me wax mine and my friends skis all season. I will be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: thatguy

customer_reviews.title: Flying like Vee
customer_reviews.text: The best wax I’ve ever used. I tried other big name waxes and this one by far is the best. It’s easy to apply and scrape off. And when you hit the mountain hold on you’ll be flying like Vee. I’ve used it in winter and spring conditions, either way it will have you flying down the mountain. I wax my board every other trip just to let you know. ( Vee is this snowboarder I know that no matter where you were on the mountain she would fly past you lol!)
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Max

customer_reviews.title: Yay! Hot sauce!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit my purchase started out as a nostalgic impulse. I used HotSauce exclusively through the 90's and thought it gone forever. When I saw it here I just had to buy some. Now I will be using it exclusively as long as I can get it! Just as great as I remembered. Easy to apply and scrape, and is very durable. Has given me great performance through all snow conditions this winter and now in the spring. If you're thinking of trying it, hesitate to more. If you've never tried it, Get some! This stuff is great!! ES Senior Alpine Patroller, NSP L II Instructor, PSIA
customer_reviews.author: Eman 2112

customer_reviews.title: Very good in the opinion of a casual skier
customer_reviews.text: I'm no expert in temperature specific or all-weather waxes and how they feel, but this wax has worked great in different conditions throughout the season in the northeast. (everything from -15F to 40+F, ice, crystal, powder, packed, groomed, slush...) Would definitely recommend as a basic wax that works for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Best all conditions wax for the money
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was slightly sticky on a 3 deg. day, not enough to to ruin my day but just to mention it. Next time before a very cold day I’ll switch to a cold wax. Otherwise, I will absolutely keep using Super Hot Sauce all temperature wax. Easy to go on hot. I only believe in hot waxing, as my son and grandson do so we use a lot of this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Ritt

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a really good wax. I'm not sure I'd buy it if I were racing professionally, but great for a weekend warrior. I believe it's as good as much higher priced waxes. I waxed in my workshop without protecting my floor and it was as slick as wet ice. Had to use coarse sandpaper on the floor so I wouldn't break my neck. So if it does that to cement, imagine how good the skies are.
customer_reviews.author: Lightning

customer_reviews.title: Good wax, great wax for the price. Def worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is good wax. Not the greatest ever but for the price it is spectacular. I just used it for 8 days of spring skiing with a couple days of snow, rain, slush, corn and finally sun. temps were 20's -60's and it worked great. My skis didn;t stick and I was still able to haul. I work on the snow and ski 100 days a year, I plan to keep useing the stuff. It went on just fine with an iron and seems to last as long as any other wax. I plan on buying this stuff again, but i think the block will last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: sam h.

customer_reviews.title: BEST WAX EVER
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have been avid users of Super Hot Sauce for 28 years! You can't go wrong. I've had people ask me what kind of wax I have on my skis as I'm blasting by them. There's nothing better on the market. Our daughter now tunes her owns skis with hertel super hot sauce. Passing it onto the next generation. We live in the SW and ski in SW Colorado mostly. We get all conditions and this wax out performs in every condition. We never stick to the snow :-) We love gliding across the snow swiftly and this makes it premium!
customer_reviews.author: GWen

customer_reviews.title: Huge upgrade over most shop waxes
customer_reviews.text: You don’t fully appreciate this stuff until you use after a day without a fresh wax. The difference is night and day. In the same conditions, I felt like I was going through mud to floating through space. While the difference isn’t as drastic from the wax used at most shops, I can still gain more speed and maintain speed on flats. Highly recommend this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Alex B.

customer_reviews.title: Great all-around wax
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an everyday wax, this is it. For the value you get a ton of wax that fits for most days on the slopes. I've noticed a little sticking in extremely cold temps (low single digits), but no issues when you get into the teens; honestly, skiing in single digits on packed snow isn't fun anyways so no reason to discredit the Hotsauce wax at those temps.
customer_reviews.author: Knuckles89

customer_reviews.title: Wax on, Wax off, like Mr. Miyagi
customer_reviews.text: Get glide & avoid friction. I use this wax for all temperatures, but I apply it more regularly at temperatures above 0°C/32°F when the warming snowpack has the glide characteristics of a rubber mat, & yes there have been days that I did not wax & I was almost thrown out of my ski bindings or involuntarily nollied on my snowboard due to the surface friction of the snowpack. Perfect for the long ugly side hill traverse or maintaining momentum on the flats. Hot wax, scrape, coarse brush or 3MTM buff.
customer_reviews.author: H. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Only have the basic Swix wax that came with my iron to compare this too but wow, this wax has been so much faster on my snowboard than my old wax. Based on other reviews, I weighed it on a scale and I got the advertised amount so I'm happy with that. Definitely really happy with the performance of my board now and feel like it came as advertised. This is definitely my go-to wax now.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Wax so good I think I broke my rib
customer_reviews.text: After watching some videos online I decided to buy an iron and wax my board myself. No ragrets! Easy to do and i felt waxing my board at home was better than taking it to my local shop to pay to get it done. Conditions yesterday when I was snowboarding weren't the best but after waxing my board I didn't have any trouble getting through on long flat spots. Will buy again
customer_reviews.author: jugodmyko

customer_reviews.title: This wax is super fast in deep powder
customer_reviews.text: This is officially my first Amazon review. I bought this wax for a 2 week boarding trip to Japan. I currently live in the Northeast and am from California. This wax is super fast in deep powder, ice, and packed powder groomed runs. It also lasts a very long time. I usually re-waxed my board after about 3-4 good, hard days of boarding and this stood up beyond that. My friends were all asking about the brand of this wax as they were very impressed as well. Trust me and get this wax! It won't let you down!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great all conditions wax!
customer_reviews.text: As an all season/conditions wax it worked remarkably well. You really do need to iron it on though. I tried rubbing it on cold and corking it in and lasted for just a couple runs. We had a challenging season this year (2014-15) in Northern California with wet wet spring like conditions most of the time and this wax handled it all pretty well. I was getting maybe 2 full days out of each ironed on application. Bottom line - works great and you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A solid all temp wax, great price
customer_reviews.text: This is solid snowboard wax. It's only the second wax I've ever tried, but it outperformed the first all temp wax (I forget the name) substantially. I have a sintered board and the wax has held up nicely for 3 sessions (one 15F, one 20F, one 40F). My friend used it on an extruded board and it is performing just as well. I expect the sintered board to need to be waxed every 5 sessions for that speedy feel, as it is starting to wear down. Pretty solid for an all temp wax if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: preston

customer_reviews.title: Good, no complaints. Lasts well, slippery, easy to apply.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good for casual skiing. Seems to last at least as long as some all-temp Swix wax that I used to have before this and I can't tell if one or the other works any better. No complaints - used it on decent skis and skiboards and they felt very slippery on the snow with it. Good price for the quantity. I can't tell how it compares to high-end and narrow temperature waxes, but I don't see a reason for a casual skier who goes out a dozen or two dozen times a year to need anything more.
customer_reviews.author: Kocho

customer_reviews.title: "Super wax"
customer_reviews.text: I must say that i am impressed with this wax on my snowboard. Goes on nice with a heat-gun. It feels very fast in dry powder, and doesn't stick to wet snow like other waxes. I rode on a fresh wax all day on packed wet snow, some powder, and some ice, and there was still a little wax left on the board at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: SavedNFS

customer_reviews.title: Good ski wax
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. The first time I bought this was a few years ago. It worked well and was a good value so the next time I needed wax I bought it again.
customer_reviews.author: Todd's opinion

customer_reviews.title: Look. No. Further.
customer_reviews.text: I've been waxing snowboards for a long time. I was educated on waxing by my spandex-clad ski racer friends, and learned all the finer points of race tuning. I ride at a mountain with a lot of traverses, so keeping my base fast is critical for keeping up with my skier friends. This wax makes it easy. It's so very fast, and stays on the board a long time. I love this wax. I will never use anything else ever again. Not even kidding.
customer_reviews.author: Some Bozemanite

customer_reviews.title: The best stuff
customer_reviews.text: It's Super HotSauce! It's the best all around wax you can use, IMHO. HOWEVER, when I wax 1. I always hot wax and 2. I run a bead of this and, ESPECIALLY if it's going to be warmish, a bead of canning wax. Killer combo!
customer_reviews.author: Saltydog

customer_reviews.title: by the end of our day the skis were running better but still sticky
customer_reviews.text: Took a year before I got the bug to use the wax but I finally did it. The first time I used it it was very cold and the wax was sticky, by the end of our day the skis were running better but still sticky. Second and third day it was warmer and skis ran faster and smoother. Wife doesn't want me to wax her skis, but I will and will use this block again. I am not a tuner but I ironed on the wax and scrapped off a large amount, I may have used too much wax. I will try using less wax my next wax job.
customer_reviews.author: BuckyB

customer_reviews.title: So happy to have Hertel Super Hot Sauce to buy again!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to use Hertel ski wax back in the day when it was carried in shops around Detroit. I LOVED HERTEL WAX because there was ZERO guesswork - apply to skis, it just worked. I thought that Hertel went out of business as I could no longer get it. I’m stoked I can get it because it makes it possible to hot wax my skis without having to guess what wax to use. Super Hot Sauce RULES!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M. Parrott

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: What hype this product is. I read through many reviews and the Hertel document on their website. Reading that will make you think this wax makes you an Olympian rider. It works but that's the extent. Literally no difference than a wax that the ski resort would use to hotwax your board. That being said it does save you money as this is a big chunk of wax which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is a great all round wax
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is a great all round wax. I ski recreationally about 20-30 days a year and recently started waxing my own skis. I don't want to be bothered with having multiple ski waxes (especially since I don't necessarily know when the next time I will ski is). This worked really well for me on both below freezing days and warm spring days. I've had multiple people notice me gliding in the lift lines and ask what kind of wax I use. Clearly Hertel is doing something right!
customer_reviews.author: Danny Ives

customer_reviews.title: A great hot wax for skis
customer_reviews.text: I noticed a distinct difference after waxing with Super Hotsauce. Makes skis glide effortlessly over powder and on the flats. Doesn't take much wax either.
customer_reviews.author: Dr DT

customer_reviews.title: Not So Super Hot Sauce
customer_reviews.text: I’m not impressed. There is a lot of unwarranted hype associated with this product. I found it to be a lot less reliable than claimed.
customer_reviews.author: DanAzonPrime

customer_reviews.title: all temp/conditions super wax
customer_reviews.text: Great wax, as others have stated it works for pretty much all temps/conditions. My wax routine consists of putting down the hardest cheap wax I can find as a good base layer to protect my skis/boards and then finishing it with a coat of super hot sauce. I generally reapply super hot sauce every two days and once a month (or when I'm super motivated) start from scratch with a hard base. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: jonny80s

customer_reviews.title: all temperature with small compromise
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sold on "all temperature" but haven't had opportunity to try this wax in extreme warm or cold yet. It works well in typical winter temperature ranges, I've skied this wax from teen's to low mid-30's Fahrenheit and it's done the job. I don't think it's as slick as temp specific Swix waxes, but the rest of my family can't tell the difference. No racers here, just recreational skiers and a retired instructor, so this will do. And regardless of "all temperature" the price just can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good Base Wax
customer_reviews.text: I mixed this with FC739 race wax and it works well on sintered bases. I live in Colorado and it works well at high elevation in Summit County.
customer_reviews.author: Devin S. Khavithone

customer_reviews.title: So Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived sooner than expected. Came with instructions and a sticker, and who doesn't like stickers!? I have not hot waxed my skis with this one yet, however crayon waxing got a few complaints from my overly cautious wife. The wax stayed on all day and it was lightning fast, so fast that it was hard to stay put in the lift line without using my poles. I will definitely be ordering more of this.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable product in all temperature and snow conditions
customer_reviews.text: To date, I have had the best results surrounding me when travelling a traverse or a gentle slope. This year alone,I have 23 days on my board and I have used this wax and the result have been fantastic. I am a fanatic of performance and this is the best wax I ever used. It has performed very well in a wide range of temperature and snow conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Rousseau

customer_reviews.title: Shred the gnar
customer_reviews.text: Works great, highly recoomended. If you've never applied this wax I suggest watching a YouTube video or two on how to apply. I bought a cheap iron at Wal-Mart and it goes on easy. I can now shred the gnar faster than ever!
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Great all around wax
customer_reviews.text: Great all around wax. Waxing tips: 1. You usually need less wax than you think 2. Scraping is much easier with a nice sharp edge, get a scraper sharpener 3. Don't go crazy with the brushes, excess wax melts off in the snow due to friction 4. Waxing is not just about going faster it also protects your skis making them last longer
customer_reviews.author: hevnzeyes

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to its reputation.
customer_reviews.text: Waxed up really well. Slick on the slopes. What's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: TjU

customer_reviews.title: Best wax to use for warm weather.
customer_reviews.text: Hot waxed my board for california conditions. Easy to scrape. Fast and smooth, recommend waxing after every 2 to 3 days in warm weather with man made snow.will last me over 10 snowboard wax jobs. Better than burtons wax i previously used.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M.

customer_reviews.title: Used twice, one time by simply scrubbing skis with ...
customer_reviews.text: Used twice, one time by simply scrubbing skis with it, and the second using the proper ski iron. Cold application did improve sliding, bringing the experience to a completely new category, but lasted only for 20 minutes or so, while the hot application lasted for the 2 hours of the first run, and noticeably wore off only after 30-60 minutes of the second day. I cannot compare this wax to other modern waxes on the market, but this one works well.
customer_reviews.author: Maxim

customer_reviews.title: Best wax around!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome wax. Works great for all conditions and doesnt cost much at all. Nice fast wax that can hold up to several days of riding before rewax (depending on the conditions, of course). This is the only wax I have been using for the past few years and I will definitely continue using it season after season.
customer_reviews.author: Alan D

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well on skis
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once so far but goes on good with iron
customer_reviews.author: Dean  Chrissley

customer_reviews.title: This wax is great. I used it in snowy cool conditions and ...
customer_reviews.text: This wax is great. I used it in snowy cool conditions and I noticed my edges getting "dry" after about 4 days. I recently tried a green wax that starts with a D, because it was free. It wore off after two days. Luckily I brought a small stick of this wax and I was able to crayon it on for the rest of my trip and had a great ride the next 5 days.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great option
customer_reviews.text: I've often had trouble deciding what wax to use since east coast weather can change drastically from week to week. I've been using Hot Sauce for a couple of seasons and it's worked great in all conditions. I would recommend this to anyone who doesn't wax their gear before every day on the hill
customer_reviews.author: VTKeeper

customer_reviews.title: My Skis Seemed Slow
customer_reviews.text: I put this wax on my new skis twice. I seemed to be going slow straight down hill compared to others. It was 10 degrees F.
customer_reviews.author: Flick

customer_reviews.title: This wax is super hots
customer_reviews.text: This wax is super hots, even my sloppy wax jobs held up. Definitely a great wax for all temps, I totally notice the difference compared to other brands I used. It held up well and last surprisingly long. Even on extruded bases it lasted a good while. Get it this wax!
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Great Wax
customer_reviews.text: This wax is great. I used it on my snow board for the first time this season and it felt awesome. I have never waxed my own board and it came with easy to follow directions and a guide describing how to use the wax as well as the other types available. I highly recommend this wax.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad trade off for saving the mess of using an ...
customer_reviews.text: I noticed increased speed right away. Instead of lagging behind my fellow skiers I am often in front. Followed directions on the pkg. and crayoned it on using RAY'S WAY wax wizard to smooth out the wax, applying as much pressure as I could. Crayoning seems to save the amount used, but I will probably have to apply more often. Not a bad trade off for saving the mess of using an iron.
customer_reviews.author: VM

customer_reviews.title: Was skeptical, but it's good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of glowing reviews about this wax and I have to admit, I was pretty skeptical. At the urging of a local board shop, I decided I'd give it a try. It's everything everyone said it'd be. I live in Ohio, and we board in A LOT of ice and this wax was not only fast and smooth, but lasted a good 3 full days of shredding. Other waxes started to leave my edges dry after one or two runs. I'm very pleased with this wax and will continue to use it from now on. Price wasn't bad either for the size of the brick.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Be aware
customer_reviews.text: Wax takes multiple passes with an iron to adhere to the board tries to flake off when it cools. When you scrape it you have to scrape it hot which means iron scrape iron scrape honestly more worth it to buy a more expensive wax it's easier to apply
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery boyle

customer_reviews.title: Good wax, will continue to buy
customer_reviews.text: This is great wax for all around surfaces, I would not recommend for serious racers. As someone who ski's a moderate amount this is a great wax for east and west coast skiing and it's very easy to apply and scrape
customer_reviews.author: Jason Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this wax. It comes with plenty of wax too so it will last multiple seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Y.

customer_reviews.title: Ok.....
customer_reviews.text: Decent wax made for middle temps. Sticky in warm weather and not great in colder weather. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Evans

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I rode on my old skis today after putting this on. Temp was in the 30s, but it went well.
customer_reviews.author: KALVO

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a good amount of general wax
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a good amount of general wax. Nice to have skis glide efficiently every time I tune or wax.
customer_reviews.author: delo609

customer_reviews.title: OKish
customer_reviews.text: Good wax for summer ski preservation, and initial cleaning, before real deal swix wax is applied for proper sliding of skis.
customer_reviews.author: Volare

customer_reviews.title: Great Wax for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a ski wax that works in all but extreme conditions, less than 0 F and very wet snow above 32 F. I've used this stuff for years. For super cold I use Dominator Sport Bullet and for warm conditions ZUMWax Yellow.
customer_reviews.author: M. Atherton

customer_reviews.title: Hands Down Best Wax on the Market!
customer_reviews.text: This wax is phenomenal. I've used my fair share of waxes from varying temperatures to fluorinated waxes to all temp ones. This "Super Hot Sauce" is the best there is. It's a new BS wax that gets the job done and so far I have absolutely no complaints. It melts at a very low temp and is very easy to apply. With this wax I have passed fellow snowboaders and skiers on catwalks. It is fast. For the price this can't be beat so get this in your kit immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: A lot of wax for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great wax. Does its job and the price is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: It was, large amount last for a while, great value for price
customer_reviews.author: Reverie

customer_reviews.title: Great all condition wax.
customer_reviews.text: You could run around trying to collect five or six waxes for every condition and have to change them based upon the temp/snow, etc. -OR- you could but this wax and not worry about it. It works well enough. I have five skiers in the family so it is nice to not have to spend a ton of money on specialty waxes. My son even uses this for racing and says it is good enough.
customer_reviews.author: JJGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great Wax - Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I feel my board is faster after waxing with this than it ever was. Extremely high performance. Great Wax
customer_reviews.author: Seth K.

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: used this in 55 and below 35 temps on my board at heavenly this season. worked great helping me pass the slow folks on the traversing trails at sky express and stage coach. will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: capucine

customer_reviews.title: Fast and wax lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I'm reviewing cause after a couple years, I'm back to buy some more! I wax my board often, and this brick has lasted me a long time! and even waxing the boards of my friends! I've cruised past people on the flats, and once someone asked as I flew by "what?! what wax do you use?!?" (no joke). Too bad I didn't remember the brand name or I would have told him. This brand works. I'm a local from Utah, and this works in slushy days or in the 6-degree freezers.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Super Hot Sauce is BOSS
customer_reviews.text: after reading other reviews i decided to order a brick and give it a shot. i was VERY pleased with this wax... Its great because it goes on clear and scrapes easily. Then it rides great in all conditions! sticky days were fine and even single digit days. very versatile, very affordable. I highly recommend everyone to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden

customer_reviews.title: I've used this twice this season to keep my board ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this twice this season to keep my board waxed and it works very will compared to some of the others. Also it goes on almost clear so it does not distort the color on your board.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: This wax is great.  smells good too!
customer_reviews.text: We love this stuff! We've been waxing our own skis and snowboards for years. It also smells good :-) Just sweep it up before you track it around the ping pong table.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. J.

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: item was as expected. thanks! Definitely use an old iron and head up drops of the wax into snowboard, and then scrape it clean off
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Iron temp too low
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t ridden on it yet, iron temp had to be about 120 degrees Celsius not 90 and it was really rubbery but it seemed prett good and the price was fair
customer_reviews.author: Sullivan Andrus

customer_reviews.title: This is All conditions Wax.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this wax for years. It works in all conditions and has a great price. I like my skis freshly waxed when I go so I go through a couple of bricks a year. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Good, serviceable hot wax
customer_reviews.text: Good, serviceable hot wax that we use on our ski's. We tend to use it for base and put a little molly on top. Does a good job without the molly. Does great with the molly (molybdenum).
customer_reviews.author: C2CO

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: First time using this. Put it on for my spring maintenance waxing, seemed to go on good smooth and easy to apply. Looking forward to testing it out on the slopes this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You'd have to bring this wax to a pro to get a good baseline.
customer_reviews.text: worked well on my snowboard. I got about 5 rides in before I noticed a small cracking. Probably just my novice level of waxing a snowboard. You'd have to bring this wax to a pro to get a good baseline.
customer_reviews.author: shockwavecs

customer_reviews.title: I use this on all my gear as well as ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this on all my gear as well as my friends. I normally purchase to bars and then ask my friends for $5 for me to wax and edge their boards, I end up paying for the wax and the edger with the money.
customer_reviews.author: Satyagrah4

customer_reviews.title: great wax but i left off doing rubs and just ...
customer_reviews.text: great wax but i left off doing rubs and just melt it on with hot iron. worked well for me, easy to use, coat lasts a long time, great wax for me.
customer_reviews.author: MarkieMark

customer_reviews.title: best all temp wax on the market for an amazing price.
customer_reviews.text: pretty much the only wax i use. Even if i use a fancier cold weather or hot weather wax i mix a bit of hot sauce in and am very happy with it. Won't be buying more for a while, and beats swix products hands down IMO.
customer_reviews.author: EN Wags

customer_reviews.title: doesn't weigh 3/4 lb.
customer_reviews.text: Good wax, but didn't weigh in at 3/4 lbs though. The one I got had a large chunk taken out of the back, eliminating about 15% of the volume. I did weigh the block to verify too. If you're shopping based on weight, you'd better take that into account. Otherwise, this wax works as well as any other I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: t-shirt

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable Price - Fast Skis
customer_reviews.text: I wax skis for a family of five and was tired of selecting from a variety of waxes like I used to do during my racing days. This wax is relatively soft, applies well with an iron, and scrapes off easily. At the mountain, everyone had "fast" skis". It's rewarding to see your whole family passing people who don't wax their skis while on a long traverse. Skis perform better as well. Like most waxes, it will last for a couple days of hard skiing before needing reapplication.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H

customer_reviews.title: The best All Temp wax out there!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is AMAZING! It truly does work well in all temps, particularly warm ones. Non PTFE. Non Fluorocarbon. Biodegradable. You will love it, and feel good about being a bit better to nature.
customer_reviews.author: SherpaK

customer_reviews.title: Huge value considering what a large chunck of wax you ...
customer_reviews.text: Huge value considering what a large chunck of wax you get. I was using blends of other temperature sensitive waxes until I switched to this. Haven't noticed a difference yet. I haven't tried it in spring conditions yet though.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Best! I use this on my skate skis
customer_reviews.text: Best! I use this on my skate skis, and it's just perfect. In all temps. Thanks for making it affordable and awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Rule

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It gets a little sticky in extrem cold. Dose grate in 99% of conditions
customer_reviews.author: robert dugdale

customer_reviews.title: Works great, best deal
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I don't race and haven't done any scientific tests to say if it's faster or slower than the Swix stuff, but who cares. I can't feel any difference between this and the expensive stuff, it's slick and the best deal out there. A nice big chunk that will last me a while, I'll definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: ashtong63

customer_reviews.title: Great wax
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with his wax. I find myself sliding past the annoying flat spots on the hill more readily. Also I've gotten a solid 3 days on this wax. Could go more I guess. On my other wax by the end of the second day the skis were sticking.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Gary

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Wax
customer_reviews.text: I have used this wax multiple times already. it lasts for quit some time and there were multiple times that I went boarding while gliding right down the mountain.
customer_reviews.author: richie arellano

customer_reviews.title: Great Wax
customer_reviews.text: Great Wax, and a good buy. I applied Hertel to my skis, and skied Hount Hood Meadows April powder. i was very impressed. Hertel hot sauce is much better than the other name brand all temperature wax, which i have been using, lately. The Hertel wax glided like fluoro wax thru the moist powder. And, the block of Hertel hot sauce wax was three times bigger than the name brand and the same price!
customer_reviews.author: S. Howze

customer_reviews.title: Good size, lots of applications.
customer_reviews.text: If you like to take care of your own skis or don't have time to drop off and pick up at the shop its an easy solution. Big enough for lots of waxings. However I think it is a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: JerryLandi

customer_reviews.title: This isn't the fastest wax, that's for sure. ...
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the fastest wax, that's for sure. I've used in everything from sub zero to 50*. It didn't seem to be magical in any temp.
customer_reviews.author: Tom G

customer_reviews.title: this super hot sauce is worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used many waxes, but from what I feel and can tell when on the slopes, this wax is awesome! Maintaining speed during the shallow/flats is not a problem, I often pass skiers/riders that were probably going the same or faster speed as me going down the hill before the flats. Prepare to wait for your friends while using this wax :p i would recommend this to anyone who waxes their own board/skies.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The dog does *not* like this stuff, and my drip lines are safe.
customer_reviews.author: Guargumon

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.  Good return on investment.
customer_reviews.text: Price is fair; the wax seems fast (from ~10f to ~30f) lasts pretty well; simpler than the multi color systems. I iron it onto pre-warmed bases and wait ~30 min then scrape with sharp plexi scraper and buff or brush.
customer_reviews.author: Bob D.

customer_reviews.title: The best all temp wax I have found.
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I tried this wax. I get better glide across flats and traverses than I ever did. You cannot go wrong with this product. If you are a ski tech you may be able to mix a faster wax for every condition. If you ain't got time for that, this wax will do you right. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: snowlion

customer_reviews.title: As the snow warmed up glided past all my ski ...
customer_reviews.text: As the snow warmed up glided past all my ski partners on gentle slopes & flats. Even worked well as snow got very warm and sloppy.

customer_reviews.text: GNARLY bit of wax totally made me shred faster and my board felt much smoother. Really easy to melt on and scrape.

customer_reviews.title: Great wax for just about any conditions
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this stuff for years and it never disappoints! Great wax for just about any conditions.

customer_reviews.text: I use it with. They're waxless which eliminates the need for temperature-specific grip wax but they still need glide wax. Super Hot Sauce does the job.

customer_reviews.title: I love this wax
customer_reviews.text: I love this wax! It holds up better than any other wax I've used and for the price you really can't beat it!
